intro: Bertiera lanx, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm climates.
